items.short_desc: In this episode of Timeout with SportsAdda, we discuss the January transfer window and how the big clubs have gotten what they wanted in the squad.
items.asset_title: Timeout with SportsAdda EP 10: Winter transfer window talks

items.short_desc: Numbers that might help you win better in Bangladesh vs West Indies first​ Test.

items.short_desc: The much-awaited home series for Team India​ begins on 3rd February when they take on England​ at Chennai. We preview and pick the players you can count on.
items.asset_title: Timeout with SportsAdda EP9: India vs England 1st Test preview

items.short_desc: Here are the numbers that matter when Arsenal​ host Manchester United​ at the Emirates​ Stadium.​ Who do you think will get the three points tonight?
items.asset_title: Arsenal vs Manchester United - Numbers that help you win!

items.short_desc: In-form Manchester​ United lose to bottom place Sheffield United at home and the momentum gaining Gunners welcome them next at the Emirates stadium. Lampard​ has been replaced by Tuchel​ at Chelsea and many more in this episode of Timeout with SportsAdda.
items.asset_title: Timeout with SportsAdda EP8: Man Utd lose with a trip to Emirates next, Tuchel to Chelsea

items.short_desc: In this episode of Timeout with SportsAdda we talk about Liverpool's loss at Anfield after four years and Lampard not having a good season with big names.

Game Rules

  • Users will get a total of '100 coins' for every match.
  • These coins can be split up between a maximum of 10 players or used on any one player as well.
  • Unused coins will lapse after each match and won’t be carried forward.
  • Entries once submitted cannot be changed.
  • Users shall win points only if their ‘pick’ matches the player announced as the Man of the Match in the post-match presentation.
  • Points calculation: Coins allotted to the winning player X 10 will be the total points earned per match. So, if you allot 30 points to a player and if he is the Man of the Match, you will earn 30 X 10=300 points.
  • Users will make it to the leaderboard according to the points earned on each match day.
  • The top five users having the most points on the leaderboard at the end of the series/tournament/league, shall be announced as the winners of the game.
  • The winners will receive an email from SportsAdda with steps to redeem the prize.

Terms and Conditions

  • SportsAdda reserves the right to revise these Terms & Conditions at any time without prior notice to the participant.
  • Your act of participating in the Contest shall be deemed to be your absolute agreement to the Terms and Conditions, Terms of Use, and User Generated Content of SportsAdda as prescribed from time to time.
  • SportsAdda shall announce the Contest via promos across digital platforms and any other mode or medium as deemed fit including but not limited to newspaper ads, radio, outdoor or any other medium of exploitation which shall be at the sole discretion of SportsAdda.
  • SportsAdda reserves the right to cancel and/or postpone the Contest without any prior intimation to the participants.
  • The winner shall be announced on the social handles of SportsAdda and /or Website or any other medium as SportsAdda may deem fit and necessary at its sole discretion.
  • It is clarified hereby that SportsAdda shall have a discretionary right to postpone/ cancel/change the destination of the Prize of reasons of unavoidable circumstances/natural calamities.
  • Participants must be at least 18 years old at the point of Contest registration. Participants under the age of 18 years shall be disqualified from the Contest.
  • The Contest prizes are not transferable. No substitution of prizes for other goods and services is permitted, except SportsAdda reserves the right to provide a substitute prize of approximately equal value if the advertised prize is unavailable. All expenses not specified above, including, without limitation, all federal, state and local taxes, and international tariffs, are the sole responsibility of the individual winner.
  • Receiving a prize is contingent upon compliance with these rules.
  • In the event that a potential winner is disqualified, or the prize is forfeited for any reason, SportsAdda will award the applicable prize, time permitting given the nature of the prize, to the next eligible runner-up participant.
  • Participants’ personal information will be subject to SportsAdda’s Privacy and Cookie Policy, available at for the purposes listed therein. Furthermore, Participants’ personal information will be processed for the purpose of organizing, running and monitoring the Contest and prize fulfilment, including, if Participant wins a prize, publishing (i) their name on the Winner(s) List and (ii) their name and country of residence online or in any other media in connection with the Contest.
  • By participating in this Contest, each Participant further agrees:
    • (a) (To the extent permissible by law) assumes sole liability for injuries, including personal injuries and/or damage to property, caused or claimed to be caused by participating in any tournament or acceptance, possession, or use of any award; and
    • (b) By participating in this Contest, each Participant acknowledges: (1) In regard to the prize and any other products or services given by SportsAdda and its affiliates free of charge, SportsAdda shall only be liable for intent and gross negligence. (2) In all other cases, the SportsAdda shall only be liable to cases of intent and gross negligence. In case of slight negligence, however, SportsAdda is only liable for the breach of essential contractual obligations, such as delay or impossibility of performance, which SportsAdda can be made responsible for. The liability in the event of breach of such an essential contractual obligation is limited to the typical contractual damage, whose occurrence could be expected by SportsAdda upon conclusion of the contract on account of the circumstances known at that time. “Essential contractual obligations” as previously stated are those obligations whose fulfilment is essential to enable the proper implementation of the contract and the achievement of its purpose and whose observation you as an end consumer may rely upon. The foregoing limitations of liability shall not apply in the case of explicit guarantees by SportsAdda, in case of malice and injuries to life, body or health as well as in the case of mandatory statutory regulations.
    • (c) That the SportsAdda’s decisions will be final and binding on all matters related to this Contest;
    • (d) The Contest is governed by the laws of the India and all claims must be resolved in India. Nothing in these rules shall have the effect to deprive you of the consumer protection rights granted to you by the laws of your residence that cannot be derogated from by agreement.
    • (e) SportsAdda reserves the right to cancel, suspend and/or modify the Contest, or any part of it, if any fraud, technical failures or any other factor impairs the integrity or proper functioning of the Contest, as determined by SportsAdda in its sole discretion. If terminated, SportsAdda may, in its sole discretion, determine the winners from among all non-suspect, eligible entries received up to time of such action using the judging procedure outlined above. SportsAdda, in its sole discretion, reserves the right to disqualify any individual it finds to be tampering with the entry process or the operation of the Contest or to be acting in violation of these rules or those of any other Contest or in an unsportsmanlike or disruptive manner and void all associated entries. Any attempt by any person to deliberately undermine the legitimate operation of the Contest may be a violation of criminal and civil law, and, should such an attempt be made, SportsAdda reserves the right to seek damages and other remedies (including attorneys’ fees) from any such person to the fullest extent permitted by law. SportsAdda’s failure to enforce any term of these Rules shall not constitute a waiver of that provision.
    • (f) By accepting any of the prizes, you acknowledge and agree that the SportsAdda and its designees have the right to use any information provided during the Contest in the administration, marketing, and promotion of the Contest without further consent or compensation to you.

seo.meta_desc: The bowling all-rounder was replaced by Shahbaz Nadeem in the first eleven.
seo.browser_title: Injured Axar Patel ruled out of India vs England first Test

data.title: Injured Axar Patel ruled out of India vs England first Test
data.full_text:
India’s spin bowling all-rounder Axar Patel was ruled out of Friday’s Test match between India and England after he complained of pain in his left knee. Patel was included in the Indian squad in place of the veteran Ravindra Jadeja, who is nursing an injury himself.

The last-minute change saw Indian team including left-arm spinner Shahbaz Nadeem and Deepak Chahar in the main squad from the list of standby players.

"Axar Patel has been ruled out of the first Paytm Test against England. The all-rounder complained of pain in his left knee during Team India's optional training session on Thursday," BCCI secretary Jay Shah stated in a press release.

"He is being monitored by the BCCI Medical Team and while his detailed reports are awaited, he will not be available for selection for the opening match," Shah further stated.

Axar Patel ruled out of first @Paytm #INDvENG Test; Shahbaz Nadeem & Rahul Chahar added to India squad

More details 👉 https://t.co/2uk74iyVpW pic.twitter.com/MpUdUGMauB

— BCCI (@BCCI) February 5, 2021

"The All-India Senior Selection Committee has added spinners Shahbaz Nadeem and Rahul Chahar to India's squad. Both Nadeem and Chahar have been training with Team India as part of the standby group of players," the release also stated.

A regular in the Indian T20 League, Axar Patel has played 38 ODIs and 11 T20Is for India previously and was in line to make his Test debut.

India made multiple changes to their first eleven for the Chennai Test match, from the side that won the historic Test match at Gabba last month, with Virat Kohli, Ishant Sharma, Nadeem, Ravichandran Ashwin, and Jasprit Bumrah coming in.

Feature Image Courtesy: AFP/ Michael Bradley
data.intro_text: The bowling all-rounder was replaced by Shahbaz Nadeem in the first eleven.
data.browser_title: Injured Axar Patel ruled out of India vs England first Test

items.short_desc: Ahead of the opening T20I to be played at the newly named Narendra Modi Stadium, here we look at 3 memorable T20I encounters between India and England.
items.asset_title: Three most memorable India-England T20I clashes

items.short_desc: Riding on the brilliance of Axar Patel and Rishabh Pant, India outclass England by an innings and 25 runs in the final Test in Ahmedabad, bag the series with a 3-1 win.
items.asset_title: Twitter goes into a spin as India win 4th Test, seal WTC final spot

items.short_desc: Pant and Sundar’s 113-run partnership saw India steady the ship and eventually end Day 2 with an 89-run lead.
items.asset_title: Twitter hails Rishabh Pant’s heroic ton after India’s early batting collapse

items.short_desc: Chasing only 49 runs to win the pink-ball Test, India's opening duo of Rohit Sharma (25) and Shubman Gill (15) guided India to a clinical victory.
items.asset_title: Twitter reacts as India thrash England in two days to take 2-1 series lead

items.short_desc: With the pink ball swinging more than a red ball, the England cricket team will be optimistic about their chances in Motera.
items.asset_title: IND vs ENG: Not bothered with England’s strengths, says Virat Kohli

items.short_desc: Pacer Umesh Yadav has been drafted into the squad for the third and fourth Tests in place of Shardul Thakur.
items.asset_title: Team India announce squad for final two Tests against England

items.short_desc: After Ravichandran Ashwin’s brilliant century on Day 3, Axar Patel’s five-wicket haul saw India beat England by 317 runs.
items.asset_title: Virat Kohli hails Axar Patel, R Ashwin as India register historic win

items.short_desc: Ravichandran Ashwin and Virat Kohli’s 96-run partnership late on Day 3 saved the blushes for India after an early batting collapse.
items.asset_title: Twitter bows down to Ashwin’s all-round display as India take control on Day 3

items.short_desc: Rohit stitched a 162-run partnership with Ajinkya Rahane for the fifth wicket to help India post 300 for six wickets at the end of first day’s play.
items.asset_title: Twitterati laud Rohit Sharma for putting India in a dominant position

items.short_desc: This is for the first time that Virat Kohli has been dismissed for a duck by a spinner in Test cricket.
items.asset_title: India vs England, 2nd Test: Virat Kohli creates unwanted record in Chennai

items.short_desc: India and England have played 123 Test matches, and while the former has won 26, the latter has emerged victorious on 48 occasions.

items.short_desc: The 25-year-old pacer was unable to train on Thursday and had taken an injection in his right elbow.

asset_data.short_desc: Team India captain Virat Kohli has been blessed with a baby girl after his wife Anushka Sharma gave birth to the child at the Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai.
asset_data.asset_title: Virat Kohli and wife Anushka welcome baby girl

asset_data.short_desc: Virat Kohli has claimed top honours at the ICC Awards while Steve Smith and Rashid Khan have also bagged prestigious awards.
asset_data.asset_title: ICC Awards: Virat Kohli bags top honours, find complete winners list

asset_data.short_desc: Josh Hazlewood, who was the wrecker in chief during Australia's eight-wicket win over India in the first Test, has said that the visitors will have a tough time in the remaining games of the series.
asset_data.asset_title: India do not have any batsman of Virat’s class, says Josh Hazlewood

asset_data.short_desc: Shane Warne believes Virat Kohli’s absence beyond the first Test match in Adelaide will be a massive blow for India.
asset_data.asset_title: Shane Warne picks his favourite ahead of India-Australia Test series

asset_data.short_desc: From Virat Kohli equalling Rohit Sharma's record to Aaron Finch's struggle, here are some  key stats from Australia's 12-run win over India in the 3rd T20I.

asset_data.short_desc: Virat Kohli-led Team India will look to wrap up the three-match T20I series against Australia at the SCG on Sunday. Here’s Australia vs India, 2nd T20I fantasy preview.
asset_data.asset_title: Australia vs India 2nd T20I Fantasy Preview: Team, pitch report and probable XI

asset_data.short_desc: From Steve Smith's hammering of Indian bowlers to Virat Kohli's record milestone, here's a detailed look at the statistics from the second ODI between India and Australia.
asset_data.asset_title: India tour of Australia: Key stats from the second ODI

asset_data.short_desc: India captain Virat Kohli will skip the last three matches of the Test series against Australia as he will fly back to India to attend the birth of his first child.
asset_data.asset_title: Three players who can replace Kohli at No. 4 for the last three Tests against Australia

asset_data.short_desc: India have a few options in their Test squad to replace Rohit Sharma, but with Virat Kohli also out after the first Test, they will want to fill in the void with best alternatives.
asset_data.asset_title: India tour of Australia: Who should replace Rohit Sharma in Test?

asset_data.short_desc: The Australian batsman also noted the stark difference in the captaincy approaches of Virat Kohli and Ajinkya Rahane.
asset_data.asset_title: Won’t retaliate to India’s sledging, claims Warner

asset_data.short_desc: Virat Kohli has had little success in eight seasons as skipper of Bangalore and the franchise has been underperforming for so long, something that should bring scrutiny on him.
asset_data.asset_title: Should Virat Kohli step down as Bangalore captain?

asset_data.short_desc: As the illustrious India skipper turned 32 today, his fellow cricketers from the present and past alike took to Twitter to wish him on his special day.
asset_data.asset_title: Birthday greetings from fellow cricketers pour in for Virat Kohli

asset_data.short_desc: Virat Kohli's Bangalore take on Punjab with a hope of winning their third game on the trot.
asset_data.asset_title: Bangalore look to strengthen spot in top four with win over Punjab

asset_data.short_desc: In what's possibly the most dragged out Indian T20 League game of the season, we witnessed a spectacle from Virat Kohli on T20 batsmanship.
asset_data.asset_title: The Virat Kohli T20 masterclass on anchoring

asset_data.short_desc: Bangalore captain Virat Kohli has become the second-fastest player to reach a unique T20 milestone.
asset_data.asset_title: Virat Kohli becomes first Indian to score 9000 T20 runs

asset_data.short_desc: Bangalore skipper Virat Kohli has scored a mere 18 runs in three innings this  Indian T20 League season, and history suggests that he is going to have a hard time going forward.
asset_data.asset_title: Bangalore vs Mumbai: A statistical look at Virat Kohli's struggle

asset_data.short_desc: Mumbai have an excellent record against Virat Kohli's Bangalore in the Indian T20 League. So can MUM continue the trend or will BAN weather the storm?
asset_data.asset_title: BAN vs MUM: Defending champions eying top spot

asset_data.short_desc: Bangalore duo Umesh Yadav and captain Virat Kohli had a horrific time in the first innings against Punjab, and the fans are not excusing them at any given time.
asset_data.asset_title: Umesh Yadav and Virat Kohli getting trolled for 'buttery fingers'

asset_data.short_desc: Virat Kohli and the Bangalore are coming off a big win over Hyderabad and will aim to continue their winning start to the campaign.
asset_data.asset_title: Indian T20 League: Punjab in the hunt for season's first win against Bangalore

asset_data.short_desc: From Bangalore's best powerplay in UAE to Virat Kohli's opening game disappointment, here are the key stats from their 10-run victory over Hyderabad.
asset_data.asset_title: Indian T20 League 2020: Key stats from Bangalore's 10-run victory over Hyderabad

asset_data.short_desc: Former Australian pacer Brett Lee has said that he is backing Bangalore's Virat Kohli to win the Orange Cap in this year's Indian T20 League.
asset_data.asset_title: Indian T20 League 2020: Brett Lee expects Virat Kohli to win the Orange Cap

asset_data.short_desc: RCB skipper Virat Kohli says the extended time off opened up his perspective on life outside cricket.
asset_data.asset_title: Kohli didn't miss cricket 'as much as he thought he might'

asset_data.short_desc: India's power couple, Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma announced that the couple is expecting their first child and wishes poured in from all around the country.
asset_data.asset_title: Wishes pour in for Kohli and Anushka as couple announce pregnancy

asset_data.short_desc: It was during a Bangalore virtual meeting where Kohli issued the warning, stating that a player caught breaching the safety rules "is letting the whole team down."
asset_data.asset_title: Virat Kohli warns of 'repercussions' for breaking Indian T20 League bubble
